tharindu\_ - (28/05/2009 01:58): sdumitriu: When I change to annotations and build code, it says annotations are not supported in -source 1.3  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 01:59): What are you building?  
tharindu\_ - (28/05/2009 01:59): Its a new component  
tharindu\_ - (28/05/2009 01:59): simple basic one  
tharindu\_ - (28/05/2009 01:59): with annotations  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 02:00): You should inherit some XWiki pom  
tharindu\_ - (28/05/2009 02:00): as parent ?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 02:02): Yes  
tharindu\_ - (28/05/2009 02:03): it just solved after adding mvn-compiler-plugin  
tharindu\_ - (28/05/2009 02:03): with <source> 1.5  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 02:03): Yes  
tharindu\_ - (28/05/2009 02:04): :)  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 02:04): But you should inherit an XWiki pom  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 02:04): By the way, the version should be 1.0-SNAPSHOT, not 0.0.1  
tharindu\_ - (28/05/2009 02:05): yes, I have to remove that whole work  
tharindu\_ - (28/05/2009 02:05): it does not build, I have created some new one  
tharindu\_ - (28/05/2009 02:07): if I add parent tag similar to xwiki-observation pom will it be ok ?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 02:07): Yes

maggolo joined #xwiki at 15:00  
jk\_work joined #xwiki at 15:03  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 15:04): hi @ all, short questio related to xwiki update I have XWiki Enterprise Manger 1.4.13710, is it possible to upgrade to XEM 1.6.4 without doing all updates between this versions? In your migration note you say that the database strukture hasn't changed but not here http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise18#HCommonMigrationnotes what do i have to do, migrate my databases or not?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 15:05): The migration is automatic  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 15:05): I don't remember any recent changes, though  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 15:06): kk thx i'll give it a try  
tuska - (28/05/2009 15:06): maggolo: it's possible there is an error in XEM release note but anyway XEM is just a XE with some specific configuration and plugins so always follow XE release note closely  
jk\_work left at 15:07 (Client Quit)  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 15:07): tuska: yes i have seen if you go to migration notes of xem you will be redirecte to XE   
tuska - (28/05/2009 15:08): yes  
jk\_work joined #xwiki at 15:08  
jk\_work left at 15:09 (Client Quit)  
tachirei joined #xwiki at 15:09  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 15:09): tuska or sdumitriu do jo know if i need a new java mysql connector or is this connector know in the package?  
tuska - (28/05/2009 15:10): the mysql connector is included in "distribution" package but not in war packages  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 15:12): kk thx  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 15:56  
vmassol\_ left at 16:04 ()  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 16:08): so back with error, do someone know what went wrong see http://pastebin.centos.org/26546  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 16:22): ok i had a wrong typo in my hibernate file   
rrodriguez left at 16:24 ()  
arunreddy\_ joined #xwiki at 16:25  
jk\_work joined #xwiki at 16:29  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 16:30): last question, what xar file have to be imported in the virtual wikis? xwiki-enterprise-manager-wiki-administrator or All xwiki-enterprise-manager-application-xem  
tuska - (28/05/2009 16:30): xwiki-enterprise-manager-wiki-administrator include xwiki-enterprise-manager-application-xem+some app+XE  
tuska - (28/05/2009 16:31): xwiki-enterprise-manager-application-xem just contains some XEM specific pages to use when tranformaing an XE instance to XEM  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 16:32): ok so i have to import xwiki-enterprise-manager-wiki-administrator or  
tuska - (28/05/2009 16:33): is there something unclear in descriptions in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download ? if yes do you have an idea of a better one ?  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 16:35): A default set of XEM pages which you can load in an empty instance or after doing an upgrade  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 16:35): Only contains XEM specifics pages to be imported in an existing XE instance or after transforming to XEM  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 16:35): ??  
tuska - (28/05/2009 16:36): ok fixing it  
tuska - (28/05/2009 16:36): thanks  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 16:37): no problem thanks to you for help and for thsi great Wiki  
arunreddy left at 16:42 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 16:57  
anamarias left at 17:02 ()  
maggolo left at 17:09 ()  
tharindu joined #xwiki at 17:20  
jvdrean left at 17:23 ()  
jvelociter left at 17:32 ()  
CristinaS joined #xwiki at 17:42  
CristinaS left #xwiki at 17:43  
cristinas joined #xwiki at 17:46  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 17:47): hi!  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:47): Hi  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 17:48): sdumitriu: can I ask you some questions?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:48): Sure  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 17:48): 1. I use XWikiXmlRpcClient for the communication with the xwiki server. It is necessary to create another class to make the communication protocol transparent and use that class in the whole project, or can i use  XWikiXmlRpcClient class?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:49): Let me check a thing  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 17:50): ok  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:50): Hm...  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:50): We would need a generic API in the core for remote communication  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:50): But until that appears, you can use the client directly  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:50): It's shorter for the moment  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 17:51): ok  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:51): florinciu: Any thoughts on that?  
florinciu - (28/05/2009 17:53): I use an interface for the server calls that provides me some isolation from the communitation protocol. It has two implemtatations for XML-RPC and Velocity Services.   
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:54): Did you have the interface from the start?  
florinciu - (28/05/2009 17:54): yes  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 17:55): well for me it will be nice if I have an interface that is implemented by the XWikiXmlRpc class and the other communication classes  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:56): Yes, my point exactly  
florinciu - (28/05/2009 17:56): the disadvantage is that if she uses an interface then she needs to rewrite the model  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:56): But we don't have it yet  
florinciu - (28/05/2009 17:56): i needed that anyway since I was on another platform  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 17:57  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 17:58): maybe I should work for now with this one, in order to have something functional and when the interface is ready to change the client  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:58): Yes  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 17:58): And to make that switch easy, make sure you write a lot of tests  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 17:59): ok  
trifon joined #xwiki at 18:00  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 18:00  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:01): other question is regarding the architecture .. is it ok if I have a singleton with the client and the xwiki structure .. and to access this class from the dialog classes and so on?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:02): I don't know how OO works with multiple documents, so I can't decide now  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:02): But I guess a singleton is OK  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:02): As long as you don't reference it from a static field, but using a static getter method  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:03): ok  
rrodriguez left at 18:03 ()  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:04): and regarding the maven structure ..  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:04): what should be the version of the xoo project? 1.0 or 1.0-SNAPSHOT?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:04): 1.0-SNAPSHOT  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:04): Snapshots change  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:04): A fixed version should always be the same  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:05): 1.0 from two days ago should be the same as 1.0 from next month  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:05): I see ..  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:05): Snapshots have a timestamp attached to them, so it's easy to identify each build  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:05): The fixed version gets set during the release  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:06): When doing:  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:06): mvn release:prepare  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:06): it will ask you what version are you releasing (maven rulz)  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:06): and about the dependencies .. I put a release version in the dependency tag?   
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:07): It depends  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:07): External libraries should be final releases  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:08): for now I have to use xml-rpc-client artifact  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:08): Other xwiki dependencies can be SNAPSHOTS  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:09): but when does the snapshot change?  if I put my dependency SNAPSHOT 1.9 .. when someone makes a new version.. shouldn't be right to use the new version?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:12): Well, projects in the core get updated automatically  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:12): In the sandbox, you'll have to update it manually  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:12): oh, ok  
anamarias - (28/05/2009 18:13): update them by changing the dependency field of the POM with the new snapshot manually ?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:14): Yes  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:14): Editing the POM is OK  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:14): We do this all the time  
arkub left at 18:14 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:15): I see .. and about the documentation should I add a javadoc plugin in my pom.xml?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:15): No, it is already in the default pom  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:15): Just use:  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:15): mvn javadoc:jar  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:15): to generate it  
anamarias - (28/05/2009 18:15): nice  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:15): It does get generated automatically when doing a release, too  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:16): nice .. let me try if it works :)  
anamarias - (28/05/2009 18:16): this default pom is maven's , right ?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:16): Yes  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:16): The superpom  
anamarias - (28/05/2009 18:16): :)  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:16): Like the Object class in java, it's the one that all the poms implicitely inherit  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:17): And this is what allows projects to work with small poms  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:17): The default configuration exists, but it's hidden  
cristinas - (28/05/2009 18:17): nice  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:18): "convention over configuration" is a maven motto  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:21): sdumitriu : Hi.  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:21): Hi arunreddy\_  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:21): coming to Aggregating pom.xml.  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:22): after copyright.. parent.. wat else am i supposed to add to it.  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:22): The key element is <modules>  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:22): There you list the submodules that your project has  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:23): I have two.. xwiki-application-importer and xwiki-core-importer.   
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:23): Will they be two submodules of my project?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:23): Yes  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:24): but one is under platform/applications and the other under platform/core  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:24): No, that will be in the end  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:24): You work in the sandbox  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:24): Should i map the parent to sandbox/importexort ?  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:24): This means that you put them both in the same folder  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:26): or the core and applications snapshots respectively.  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:26): Arun, don't think about the core and the applications  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:27): For the moment you create a project in the sandbox  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:27): That's all it cares about  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:27): ok  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:28): You need this:  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:28): sandbox/gsoc/importexport  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:28):                             |- pom.xml  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:28):                             |- xwiki-application-importer  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:28):                             |    |- pom.xml  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:28):                             |- xwiki-core-importer  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:28):                                  |- pom.xml  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:29): The two submodules can have different parent poms  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:29): It's not mandatory to have the parent pom the same as the parent directory pom  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:30): Ok.  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:45): One more doubt. What is packaging of type pom.  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:45): <packaging>pom</packaging>  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:46): It doesn't package  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:46): You get packages for the submodules  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:47): So can my main module have "pom" packaging ?  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:48): sandbox/gsoc/importexport  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:48):  | - pom.xml  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:49): Sorry, if am asking too many questions. But am confused with pom a little.  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:49): Yes  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 18:50): Not "may", "must"  
kaaloo left at 18:52 ("Leaving.")  
arunreddy\_ - (28/05/2009 18:53): Thanks :)

maggolo - (28/05/2009 20:42): hi @ all is it possivle to show only explicit spaces and pages in navigation menu? till now it shows all spaces and pages and that will confusing all users if they see pages that they don't know about   
trifon left at 20:42 (Success)  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 20:43): in earlier versions i added the spaces to set ($hiddenSpaces and pages to set ($hiddenPages and removed the leading ! from if ($hiddenPages.contains and if ($hiddenSpaces.contains($space  
trifon joined #xwiki at 20:43  
rrodriguez left at 20:48 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
anamarias left at 20:50 ()  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 21:01): Hi maggolo  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 21:02): Well, you can do whatever you want with the navigation panel  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 21:02): sdumitriu: yep?  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 21:02): yes just for a view seconds i get it now it works  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 21:03): i just deleted the new lines with hiddenspaces and hiddenpages and pasted in my old once now i get only that what i want.  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 21:07): You shouldn't override the default Navigation panel  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 21:07): i don't know if thats the right way but if you have time and desire i can paste at pastbin and you can show what i have done and give a state if ist horrible or ok  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 21:07): It makes upgrades harder  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 21:07): Instead, create your own custom panel  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 21:07): MyNavigation  
sdumitriu - (28/05/2009 21:07): And use that instead  
maggolo - (28/05/2009 21:08): ok if i don,t overwrite it with the xar i don,t get any funktion lost which came with newer versions
